title: Ability to Give Reasoning to Solo Ranked dodge
body:
Riot should introduce a option to say why you have dodged in solo ranked at selection, and the ability to report trolls that make selection and inevitably the game terrible to play. Of course they'd be troll reports also, but the tribunal would be able to distinguish which is which. 
It would be easy to see who the trolls are also from chat, and the picks that the team didn't agree on or a lane was already locked in or called.

I just feel that its silly to see someone doing fine by the team, dodge pregame because there's a troll in the team before the game even starts. And they'll get the time penalty rather than the troll.

Yeah, Nah?

replies.body:
Hey Neox,

Instead of giving players the option to report and punish players that troll/fight over roles and lanes, we are working on solving the root issue. The current iteration of Team builder is a test and we are working on the next iteration of team builder. If match making can take roles into account (e.g. not match up two people who want mid) then a lot of champion select problems and frustrations will be gone.

Check out this thread on reddit a while back that had a player talking about a very similar situation, with Riot Lytes response!
https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2ws22k/i_miss_doing_tribunal_work/cou0c1c

Perhaps Rito should consider disabling blind pick for a day or two, and just use team builder for normals?

That way, team builder actually gets some use as the only reason people don't use it is because of the insane queue times. Rework it to: Top lane, Mid lane, Jungle, ADC and Support only, none of this mage mid, mage bottom etc, and then let the masses decide which one they prefer.

> Perhaps Rito should consider disabling blind pick for a day or two, and just use team builder for normals?

Or we could just get rid of blind pick altogether. Maybe even replace it with draft pick.

> That way, team builder actually gets some use as the only reason people don't use it is because of the insane queue times.

Well, if all the people who complained about TBs insane queue times actually used the queue there wouldn't be insane queue times. The **only** reason those same people have used TB before is because of things like those role icons and the SR beta.

> Rework it to: Top lane, Mid lane, Jungle, ADC and Support only, none of this mage mid, mage bottom etc, and then let the masses decide which one they prefer.

I have to disagree with you there. What you're suggesting is a standard "META" pick, which isn't the intention of the teambuilder queue. Not to mention, the current system gives *more* information to potential team mates than what you're suggesting. Rather than just getting "Support" or "Top" you get an idea on how the person is intending to play the champion.

>Or we could just get rid of blind pick altogether. Maybe even replace it with draft pick.

Yeah, but then you still have people trolling with picks. People disrespecting pick order and picking ADC even though it's already been picked because they don't wanna play support dangit!.

>Well, if all the people who complained about TBs insane queue times actually used the queue there wouldn't be insane queue times. The only reason those same people have used TB before is because of things like those role icons and the SR beta.

It's a neverending circle man. If people would use TB, TB wouldn't have huge queues, but it does, so people don't use TB. That's why I suggested disabling BP for a day or two so people get to see the matchmaking system.

>I have to disagree with you there. What you're suggesting is a standard "META" pick, which isn't the intention of the teambuilder queue. Not to mention, the current system gives more information to potential team mates than what you're suggesting. Rather than just getting "Support" or "Top" you get an idea on how the person is intending to play the champion.

I'm talking only for that specific day. People nowadays only call top mid jg sup and adc anyway, sure there are OoM (out of meta) picks as well but they're still in a lane somewhere.

All of this, and team builder lets you drop out at any time without a penalty. I don't believe normal games should have a penalty for dodging the queue either, but that's because of the current state of whiny babies that will instalock or will lock the lane/champ/role you want before you even get a chance to actually have somebody else confirm who called.
